tool.name: HTS barcode-checker
tool.description: Scan a fasta file for CITES species.
tool.command:
HTS-barcode-checker.sh $input_type.input_format #if $input_type.input_format == "hist" $input_type.input_seq $output_tsv #else $input_type.input_zip $output_zip #end if #if $location.blast_loc == "local" -lb nt #else $location.blast_database.blast_al $location.blast_database.blast_db #end if $hitlist $min_iden $min_cov $max_e $local_cites.CITES_loc #if $local_cites.CITES_loc == "local" $local_cites.CITES_db $local_cites.update.cites_update #else #if $input_type.input_format == "hist" $output_tsv.id #else $output_zip.id #end if #end if #for $add_cites_db in $add_cites_dbs -cd "${add_cites_db.add_cites_db}" #end for
#for $blacklist in $blacklists -bl ${blacklist.blacklist} #end for

param.name: blast_db
param.label: Blast protein database
param.option: Last release of the swissprot protein database
Sequences derived from the 3d structure records of the protein data bank
Non-redundant CDS sequence from environmental entries

param.name: CITES_loc
param.label: CITES database
param.option: No local CITES database, will aquire a new copy

param.name: hitlist
param.label: Maximum number of blast hits per sequence (max 20 for online blasting)

tool.help:
HTS-barcode-checker
The HTS-barcode-checker takes a fasta file and BLASTs the sequence against a reference database. The tool checks the blast results for CITES protected species and reports these to the user.
.. class:: warningmark
Selecting the online GenBank database is quite slow compared to the local blasting, if you do want to use the online database, try to limit the number of fasta sequences by clustering or filtering (Ideally sets should contain no more than a 100 sequences).
Additional files such as CITES databases (if none are provided provided the tools will download a new copy, however this can take some time) and blacklist files (genbank IDs that are incorrectly annotated) can be provided. Both types of files can be uploaded with the default galaxy "get data" function (data type needs to be set to "txt").
Reference: Lammers Y, Peelen T, Vos RA, Gravendeel B. The HTS barcode checker pipeline, a tool for automated detection of illegally traded species from high-throughput sequencing data. *BMC Bioinformatics* 2014, **15**:44.
